NEWS: ALPHA 1 RELEASED!
Alpha 1 has been released, and you don't need Eclipse! It comes with three batch files: compile.bat, run.bat and debug.bat. Compile.bat is obviosuly the compiler, and you need to set your PATH environment variable correctly (or put the JDK path inside the batch file), run.bat runs the server in production mode and debug.bat runs the server in debug mode. If you have problems with events you add, run the server in debug mode as it should print more exceptions out!
You can download it from http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha1.rar
This release includes everything in revision 38 (basically near-full woodcutting, near-full mining, better peformance using NIO, bones burying, packets/commands handled through hashmap, lots of refactoring!). Enjoy!
I hope to make more releases soon!
About the server
Basically, I want to write a server that is stable, secure, fast and reliable. Many servers are like this, but most of you find them hard to use (e.g. RS2D) and they have few features.
So, I've decided to write a Winterlove-based server, apply all the stability fixes I can throw at it, and come up with something decent for you all, with some quests and skills while I'm at it!
I'm not going to put a stupid percent meter or anything, since how do you judge it? I'm just going to post the updates as I make them, maybe add a few screenshots every now and again, etc.
This is going to be open source, but I haven't added it to the 'Downloads' section since it is far from complete. Maybe when it is a mod could move the topic or I will just make another one.
Oh, and if someone would make a logo that would be nice cos I'm a programmer, not a graphics designer.
Screenshots and videos
Since you probably want a few, here you go:
Combat!:
[img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/combat.png[/img]

[img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/greyrocks.png[/img]
Object spawns (the new ObjectManager basically) - the two fishing barrels are added from a cfg file:
[img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/staticObjects.png[/img]
Woodcutting video (with stumps disappearing!):
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/woodcuttingWithObjectManager.swf
And to prove it is not just for yourself, the same thing from a second viewpoint:
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/woodcuttingWithObjectManager2.swf
Fishing (thanks Ventrillo, who did all the code!):
[img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/fishing.png[/img]
Level up messages (and you can see the end of the still graphics, my timing was bad lol) - set to URL as I reached the 10 image limit:
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/levelupmessages.png
NPC Dialogue video:
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/dialoguesandnpcactions.swf
NPC Dialogue video (old, view one above!)!:
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/dialogue.swf
Woodcutting skill (and an NPC): [img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/woodcutting.png[/img]
Mining skill:
[img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/mining.png[/img]
Prayer - burying bones:
[img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/prayer-burybones.png[/img]
Server console (no outputting heaps of crap like a standard Winterlove server, and pretty timestamps too!): [img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/console.png[/img]
I'll add some more decent ones when there are decent ones to take!
More technical details of it
It's going to use my EventManager instead of hundreds of process() timers, so it should run very smoothly.
It has SYIpkpker protection code (3 connections per host), a huge Client object is not made on connection (less RAM usage) and is non threaded. This should make a decent impact on performance, especially on large servers.
I'm adding javadoc comments as much as possible, so when I do generate doc files it should be really easy to find out how it all works and fits together!
It is packaged, and it does not come with a build/run files. I didn't add a build/run batch files since the packaging may change when I refactor anything, and I don't want to mess around with adding them. Maybe when I do a release build I will add them, but for now, I reccomend you use a Java IDE (like Eclipse).
Picture of the way I have layed out the code/data files (now a URL cos of stupid 10 limit!):
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/codelayout.png
I am not going to answer questions on how to compile/run the beta versions of this project. That is up to you.

Subversion
Although this isn't ready, you can still grab the code. Since it's not the final release, it probably will contain bugs and not everything will be done.
Trunk URL (if you want the latest source):
https://www.grahamedgecombe.com/svn/...olutions/trunk
Alpha 7 URL (for the current stable source - reccomended!):
https://www.grahamedgecombe.com/svn/...ns/tags/alpha7
The username is shardrevolutions. There is no password. This will give you read only access to the repository.
(If you think that link is advertising then you are an idiot. My website contains nothing about private servers, apart from the Subversion for this project. If an admin/mod wants me to remove the link then I happily will, but I believe that people should be able to checkout the current source if they want.)
A good subversion client to use is TortoiseSVN (http://tortoisesvn.net/). Once you have downloaded it, create a new folder for this, right-click it and select SVN Checkout. Enter the URL. It will then prompt you for the username and password (which are above), and probably give an error about an invalid certificate. This is ok, as the certificate is self signed. Now you should have the source code! When you want to update the source code to the latest version, just right click -> TortoiseSVN -> SVN Update.
I will not be providing a virus scan. If you think a virus scanner can detect a virus in a source file, you a very wrong and I suggest you go and learn about how they work.
Updates (this certainly will grow!):
19th - 21st of September 2008
* Bugfixes. * Server GUI. * Start of trading code - nowhere near complete.
14th of September 2008
* A few fixes. * Shops complete. * Fixed the combat-related deadlock. * Various bugfixes.
13th of September 2008
* NPC drops are now fully working.
10th of September 2008
* Improved on the synchronization to fix threading issues (thanks to Thiefmn for pointing these issues out). * Remember that old ini file I made ages ago? Well, now it actually loads the configuration from it! * Sorting out fishing first/second click into one class again. * Refactoring a lot of code.
7th of September 2008
* PVNPC Meeee combat released in alpha 5! * Fixed NPC spawn glitch, thanks Optimum.
3rd of September 2008
* Fixed the combat code that has been bothering us for a while!!! * Cleaned up Ventrillo's fishing lol.
25th of August 2008
* Fixed some more synchronization issues. * Yet more sync issues (in events this time). * Ground work on combat.
24th of August 2008
* Fixed synchronization issues, now NPCs and players have a reentrant lock, remember to use it! * Now items are dropped from the slot you select. * Added fading interface in the dungeon command - thanks rsc.
23rd of August 2008
* Mining rocks now go grey when you mine them. * Added Jonas's fletching skill.
22nd of August 2008
* Object manager reads from file. * Thanks Jonas++ for helping with the 1/3/4 player text dialogues. * Object manager complete. * Bug fixes. * Woodcutting now supports stumps. * Fixed a huge event management bug which will be in release 3B.
21st of August 2008
* Did some bug fixes. * Object definitions are now loaded on startup. * Ground work on the object manager (sorry didn't have the time to finish it!). * 1/2/3/4 line NPC and 2/3/4 player choice dialogues (thanks Fallen).
20th of August 2008
* Lots of bug fixes. * Added some basic teleports. * Added level up messages. * Thanks to Ventrillo for helping getting the teleport still graphics working, and for the start of the fishing skill code!
19th of August 2008
* Added basic skeleton for dialogue system. * Dialogue loading, with a new file format that is much easier to read/use! Have yet to add the 'swords' found in the whitescape type, unsure of what they do at the moment lol. * Dialogues work! It now opens a bank dialogue on login, will change later! Thanks Jonas for the help with getting the head move. * Thanks Fallen for reporting the walking bug, it is now fixed! * Now when you walk dialogue is cancelled. * NPC actions added! Now the first/second/third click NPC actions are loaded from a file. On click, you can use OPEN_BANK, OPEN_SHOP (when a ShopManager is implemented) and TALK. TALK will open a dialogue, so now the dialogue is opened when you talk to a banker. If you bank on a banker, the dialogue is opened as well. This is in ./config/npc/actions.cfg. * NPCs now face you when you talk to it with no crashes - I got the real packet working! You also face an NPC when you talk to it. * Some minor fixes, including IOClient timeouts (to help protect against DOS attacks).
18th of August 2008
* Prospecting added. * Mining skill added. * If you walk away your current action is stopped. * Fixed addItem with adding more than one non-stackable item. * First/second/third click NPC packet skeleton. * Added a debug mode, to use it just pass the argument debug when you run the server, e.g. java -cp bin com.rs.server.Server debug. * The Stream class now auto expands better, and is set to 128 bytes for efficieny. * The garbage collector should now be run every minute to keep RAM usage down. * All the input/output is now done through the NIO API! Should be faster, and the selector (as opposed to polling) means that it is a lot less strenuous on the CPU when the server is idle. * Fixed a bug where if you logged in 3 times then logged out it would not let you login again (due to the syi protection) - thanks hayzie! * Bug fix where events would still run if you walked away. * Bug fix where server would not stop even if it didn't start. * Handling packet code is now wrapped in a try/catch statement - to protect users writing their own code. * Added inStream reset() call to keep RAM usage down.
17th of August 2008
* Packets are now handled using a hashmap. * Faster IO that runs every 30ms instead of 500ms. * The Stream class will now automatically create a larger buffer if it is needed. * Removed a lot of the things from the client class. (It is now only 9,931 bytes (around 9 kilobytes) for those who think size matters). It basically contains the raw packet handling code. All the game logic (skills, quests) will be in their own class files for ease of use. * Moved the client methods to the ActionAssistant and ContainerAssistant classes. Helps to split things up for readability. * Removed nearly everything from process() which should help with lag. It just has two checks in it: the kicked check and the global message check. These will probably be removed. * Added NPCs from scratch so they are more stable. * Added NPC/item loaders. * Moved prayer bury bones call to its skill class. * Added woodcutting (only thing left to do is make the tree stump appear after a tree is cut down - still need to work on an objectmanager for this). * Added my rewritten ItemManager from RuneFusion final build. * Added turn to update mask, and also made woodcutting turn you to the tree you cut down. * Added some more details to the PlayerDetails class (old PlayerSave). I will probably add a different way of saving/loading later, possibly from a MySQL database (optional) or binary files. * Base work on friends/ignores. * Added a membership flag (default false). If you are a member, it sets your bank size to 800, if non member 120. If you are a member, your friends list size is set to 200, otherwise 100. Ignore list size is always set to 100 (note to self, still need to init the lists!).
16th of August 2008
* I basically started working on this today. Did nothing major, just a few small things. * Did some refactoring and moved the packages around a bit. * Commands now work through a hashmap - should be faster and more reliable. And a lot easier than a huge if statement for all of them. * Added ban/mute/rights codes from the RuneFusion 1.0.5 build. * Added a UID ban to the ban processor class! * When you login you are asked to design your appearance. * Fixed Winterlove teleport in same region bug.

    * Yet more sync issues (in events this time).
    * Ground work on combat.


24th of August 2008

    * Fixed synchronization issues, now NPCs and players have a reentrant lock, remember to use it!
    * Now items are dropped from the slot you select.
    * Added fading interface in the dungeon command - thanks rsc.


23rd of August 2008

    * Mining rocks now go grey when you mine them.
    * Added Jonas's fletching skill.


22nd of August 2008

    * Object manager reads from file.
    * Thanks Jonas++ for helping with the 1/3/4 player text dialogues.
    * Object manager complete.
    * Bug fixes.
    * Woodcutting now supports stumps.
    * Fixed a huge event management bug which will be in release 3B.


21st of August 2008

    * Did some bug fixes.
    * Object definitions are now loaded on startup.
    * Ground work on the object manager (sorry didn't have the time to finish it!).
    * 1/2/3/4 line NPC and 2/3/4 player choice dialogues (thanks Fallen).


20th of August 2008

    * Lots of bug fixes.
    * Added some basic teleports.
    * Added level up messages.
    * Thanks to Ventrillo for helping getting the teleport still graphics working, and for the start of the fishing skill code!


19th of August 2008

    * Added basic skeleton for dialogue system.
    * Dialogue loading, with a new file format that is much easier to read/use! Have yet to add the 'swords' found in the whitescape type, unsure of what they do at the moment lol.
    * Dialogues work! It now opens a bank dialogue on login, will change later! Thanks Jonas for the help with getting the head move.
    * Thanks Fallen for reporting the walking bug, it is now fixed!
    * Now when you walk dialogue is cancelled.
    * NPC actions added! Now the first/second/third click NPC actions are loaded from a file. On click, you can use OPEN_BANK, OPEN_SHOP (when a ShopManager is implemented) and TALK. TALK will open a dialogue, so now the dialogue is opened when you talk to a banker. If you bank on a banker, the dialogue is opened as well. This is in ./config/npc/actions.cfg.
    * NPCs now face you when you talk to it with no crashes - I got the real packet working! You also face an NPC when you talk to it.
    * Some minor fixes, including IOClient timeouts (to help protect against DOS attacks).


18th of August 2008

    * Prospecting added.
    * Mining skill added.
    * If you walk away your current action is stopped.
    * Fixed addItem with adding more than one non-stackable item.
    * First/second/third click NPC packet skeleton.
    * Added a debug mode, to use it just pass the argument debug when you run the server, e.g. java -cp bin com.rs.server.Server debug.
    * The Stream class now auto expands better, and is set to 128 bytes for efficieny.
    * The garbage collector should now be run every minute to keep RAM usage down.
    * All the input/output is now done through the NIO API! Should be faster, and the selector (as opposed to polling) means that it is a lot less strenuous on the CPU when the server is idle.
    * Fixed a bug where if you logged in 3 times then logged out it would not let you login again (due to the syi protection) - thanks hayzie!
    * Bug fix where events would still run if you walked away.
    * Bug fix where server would not stop even if it didn't start.
    * Handling packet code is now wrapped in a try/catch statement - to protect users writing their own code.
    * Added inStream reset() call to keep RAM usage down.


17th of August 2008

    * Packets are now handled using a hashmap.
    * Faster IO that runs every 30ms instead of 500ms.
    * The Stream class will now automatically create a larger buffer if it is needed.
    * Removed a lot of the things from the client class. (It is now only 9,931 bytes (around 9 kilobytes) for those who think size matters). It basically contains the raw packet handling code. All the game logic (skills, quests) will be in their own class files for ease of use.
    * Moved the client methods to the ActionAssistant and ContainerAssistant classes. Helps to split things up for readability.
    * Removed nearly everything from process() which should help with lag. It just has two checks in it: the kicked check and the global message check. These will probably be removed.
    * Added NPCs from scratch so they are more stable.
    * Added NPC/item loaders.
    * Moved prayer bury bones call to its skill class.
    * Added woodcutting (only thing left to do is make the tree stump appear after a tree is cut down - still need to work on an objectmanager for this).
    * Added my rewritten ItemManager from RuneFusion final build.
    * Added turn to update mask, and also made woodcutting turn you to the tree you cut down.
    * Added some more details to the PlayerDetails class (old PlayerSave). I will probably add a different way of saving/loading later, possibly from a MySQL database (optional) or binary files.
    * Base work on friends/ignores.
    * Added a membership flag (default false). If you are a member, it sets your bank size to 800, if non member 120. If you are a member, your friends list size is set to 200, otherwise 100. Ignore list size is always set to 100 (note to self, still need to init the lists!).


16th of August 2008

    * I basically started working on this today. Did nothing major, just a few small things.
    * Did some refactoring and moved the packages around a bit.
    * Commands now work through a hashmap - should be faster and more reliable. And a lot easier than a huge if statement for all of them.
    * Added ban/mute/rights codes from the RuneFusion 1.0.5 build.
    * Added a UID ban to the ban processor class!
    * When you login you are asked to design your appearance.
    * Fixed Winterlove teleport in same region bug.
